# Keyboard Visualizer

A modern, high-performance web application for visualizing keyboard shortcuts and learning them through interactive quizzes.

## Tech Stack
- Frontend: React 18, TypeScript, Vite
- Backend: Supabase (Postgres, Auth, RLS)
- Performance: requestAnimationFrame-based adaptive rendering
- Styles: CSS Modules with Glassmorphism

## Core Directories
- `/src/components`: UI Components
  - `/AppHeader`: Global navigation and logo
  - `/AppSelector`: Application-specific shortcut context switching
  - `/Quiz`: AI-optimized learning engine
  - `/common`: Reusable atomic components (HeaderLogo, AppIcon, etc.)
- `/src/context`: State management (Settings, Auth, Quiz, Shortcuts)
- `/src/hooks`: Logic-only functions
  - `useKeyboardShortcuts.ts`: The "brain" of key detection
  - `useAdaptivePerformance.ts`: Real-time FPS monitoring and quality scaling
- `/src/utils`: Pure functional logic (Deduction engine, Quiz scoring)
- `/supabase/migrations`: Database schema and RLS policies

## Key Concepts
- Protection Levels: `fullscreen-preventable` vs `always-protected` (OS level).
- Adaptive Quality: High/Medium/Low rendering based on device performance.
- AI Hints: Deductive logic to identify confusing shortcuts.

## Developer Note
When modifying shortcut logic, always check `useKeyboardShortcuts.ts` for simultaneous key press detection logic.
